definition: Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
(of a smell) strong/peak season (of a crop)/(classifier for the ordinal number of a crop, in the context of multiple harvests)

sentences.english: This pressure will be the basis for well shut in and killing in case blowing out.
sentences.chinese: 今后井喷以此压力为关井和压井的依据。

sentences.english: Moisture from water vapor in the blow-by gases can enter the crankcase.
sentences.chinese: 水分水汽在井喷的气体可以进入曲轴箱。

sentences.english: Google ( GOOG - news - people ) gaps up 60 points overnight on its blow-out earnings.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌在它的井喷收入的作用下，暴涨60个点。

sentences.english: Now real consumption is kicking in, but there's a long way to go.
sentences.chinese: 现在真正的消费开始井喷，但还前面的路还很长。

sentences.english: Most of the well blowouts show obvious signs before they occur.
sentences.chinese: 绝大多数的井喷在发生前都有明显征兆。

sentences.english: Eleven" Golden Week " blowout" is no better evidence of the.
sentences.chinese: “十一”黄金周的“井喷”是再好不过的明证了。

sentences.english: To describe and analyze the health impact of the gas blowout accident on the residents in disaster areas.
sentences.chinese: 了解开县井喷事件对灾区居民健康的影响。

definition: to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
